TopicTitle: [1.2.0] Toolbar 1.7.13 - Common API for draggable/resizable buttons toolbar

Articles.Content:
I just installed version 1.7.9, and I see no toolbar in any of the menus.

My toolbar-settings.dat, if it helps:

1.7.9 works fine for me, even better then ever. I am on a Window 7 system, I deleted my toolbar-settings.dat and the old install folder before putting in the new one. I am also running KSP 1.0.2

Please upload your output_log.txt somewhere.

Just tried that again. Deleted the 000_Toolbar folder and my toolbar-settings.dat file. Re-downloaded/installed the 1.7.9.

No toolbars. :/

This may sound weird, but when was the last time you restarted your PC? Sometimes restarting PC on a daily basis flushes things out of the physical memory. My friend had problems when updating a mod from another game, and he had problems, but once he restarted it worked fine. But restarting may not be your issue.

http://pastebin.com/MvwvAMPL

Looks fine to me, no errors from the plugin.

Also: I noticed CKAN isn't picking up your update.

I don't have anything to do with CKAN right now.

Just tried running more tests.

I reverted to Toolbar v1.7.8, I see the toolbar (with the update icon, and the warning when I start KSP).

When I deleted v1.7.8 and updated to v1.7.9, I don't see the toolbar anymore.

Just tried that again. Deleted the 000_Toolbar folder and my toolbar-settings.dat file. Re-downloaded/installed the 1.7.9.

No toolbars. :/

Now I'm getting the same... NOW running FRESH install of 1.0.2 with 1.7.9, and several mods... I AM showing a few of the icons from various mods, but they are overlapped, one is a strange size, and no signs of the normal Toolbar border, autohide, etc...

When I FIRST got to the Flight screen, Exception Detector did show that Fusebox was throwing a TBIcon error...So I removed Fusebox, and got the below results...

My outputlog: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B0D_PFGuuyqoNlJrLXVxbkRVV1E/view?usp=sharing

and my KSP.log: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B0D_PFGuuyqoemdtd3J2NUQ4dUE/view?usp=sharing

I had TB set to display two, separate, single line, toolbars at the top edge of the screen, either side of the stock altimeter/GUI...

Clicking aorund the visible icons does not bring up the settings menu for TB... When I open the VOID configuration, and click the "Use Blizzy Toolbar" checkbox, it just blinks, and will not remove the icon from the stock toolbar or make it appear where the TB would be...

Screenshot

I realise I am getting errors from other mods and such, that may be affecting TB...But thought these might be useful rather than having a bone stock install with only TB installed, and it not having any buttons to display...??

I will now remove all mods except TB, and see if there's any difference...

UPDATE: Yup...With TB the only mod installed, not seeing the TB "setup" icon you are supposed to see after fresh install of the ToolBar... On ANY game screen...

@Blizzy - the link is still pointing at 1.7.8.

It is not. Refresh the download page in your browser. If that doesn't help, clear your browser's cache.

Yah, I'm gonna have to revert back to 1.7.8 to be able to use this.

It's really strange how this is happening when the mod is just a recompile for 1.7.9. @blizzy, Have you modified anything between 1.7.8 and 1.7.9?

@blizzy, Have you modified anything between 1.7.8 and 1.7.9?

No, just recompiled against KSP 1.0.2, and changed the version.txt file in the download. No code changes.

Yah, I'm gonna have to revert back to 1.7.8 to be able to use this.

It's really strange how this is happening when the mod is just a recompile for 1.7.9. @blizzy, Have you modified anything between 1.7.8 and 1.7.9?

It seems Squad has changed up the way toolbar icons are called up from installed mods QUITE a bit...

Maybe not my place to say, but I'm assuming it might be safe to say that the Toolbar mod may need more than just a simple recompile?

It seems Squad has changed up the way toolbar icons are called up from installed mods QUITE a bit...

This has nothing to do with the stock App Launcher. The Toolbar Plugin is a completely separate system.

Also: I noticed CKAN isn't picking up your update.

Please bring CKAN issues to the CKAN forum thread and don't bother mod authors with them. On a sidenote 1.7.9 is now indexed in CKAN, for better or worse.

It seems Squad has changed up the way toolbar icons are called up from installed mods QUITE a bit...

Maybe not my place to say, but I'm assuming it might be safe to say that the Toolbar mod may need more than just a simple recompile?

If that was the case, 1.7.8 wouldn't work for me. But it does.
1.7.9 working like a charm here with KSP 1.0.2
